Date class

　The function to create a Date object from a string and the function to create a string from an object have not been implemented yet, but the others are almost compatible with JavaScript Date.

　The syntax of the constructor is as follows.

new Date();
new Date(<DateString>);
new Date(<Year>, <Month(0～)=0>, <Day=1>, <Hour=0>, <Minutes=0>, <Seconds=0>);
　The first syntax requires no arguments. In this case, it sets the current date and time when this constructor was executed.
　The second syntax is to specify a date string. The date string can be in ANSI C asctime () format, defined in RFC1123 and RFC1036, or in the form "year / month / day: hour: minute: second". is needed. The date string is recognized automatically and can handle some format transformations, but it may not be recognized if the format is too different from what you expected.
　The third syntax specifies the year, month, day, hour, minute, and second.。

　Implemented methods (JavaScript compatible):
setYear/getYear (4 digit year set / get by local time)
setMonth/getMonth (Set / get month by local time)
setDate/getDate (Set / get the day according to the local time)
setHours/getHours (Set / get the hour by local time)
setMinutes/getMinutes (Set / get of minutes according to local time)
setSeconds/getSeconds (Set / get of seconds by local time)
setTime/getTime (Setting / getting milliseconds elapsed since 0:00 on January 1, 1970)
getDay (Getting the day of the week)
parse (Interpretation of date string)
